original: 2. TERM AND TERMINATION 2.1Term . This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall be valid for a period of five (5) years with automatic renewal of one year thereafter until terminated by either party with one (1) year written notice prior to the expiration of the initial period or any extension period thereof.
modified:
2. TERM AND TERMINATION

2.1 Term . This Agreement will take effect on the Effective Date and shall last for an initial term of five (5) years. Either party may elect to continue this Agreement on a year-to-year basis, with each renewal period lasting one (1) year, until either party provides written notice of termination at least thirty (30) days prior to the end of the current term or any subsequent renewal period. No additional notice will be required should a party decide not to renew this Agreement.

original: (c)In the event this Agreement is terminated for any reason, ESTABLISHMENT shall promptly cease performing any work not necessary for the orderly close out of the affected Purchase Order(s) or for the fulfillment of regulatory requirements.
modified: (c) Upon termination of this Agreement for any cause, ESTABLISHMENT retains the discretion to complete any work beyond the minimum necessary for a smooth wind-down of the relevant Purchase Order(s) or for compliance with mandatory regulatory requirements, subject to the terms and conditions agreed herein.

original: (d)Within thirty (30) days following the termination of this Agreement, and upon receiving payment for any outstanding invoices for previously fulfilled Purchase Orders, ESTABLISHMENT shall deliver to APOLLO all data and materials provided by APOLLO to ESTABLISHMENT for the manufacturing and supply activities under the impacted Purchase Order(s). Within this same timeframe APOLLO shall provide ESTABLISHMENT any reasonable compensation relative to work, materials, and WIP purchased specifically to support APOLLO’s Product. Termination of this Agreement, for any reason, shall not release either Party from liability which at said time has already incurred, nor affect in any way the survival of any rights, duties or obligations of either Party which are expressly stated elsewhere in this Agreement to survive termination. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, the Parties agree that Sections 2.2 and Articles 6, 7, 8, 9, and 10 shall survive termination of this Agreement for any reason.
ollama_generated: (d) Upon receipt by ESTABLISHMENT of payment for all outstanding invoices associated with the Purchase Orders in question, and within a reasonable timeframe following the termination of this Agreement, APOLLO will be entitled to receive from ESTABLISHMENT all data and materials that were provided by APOLLO for the manufacturing and supply activities related to the impacted Purchase Order(s). Concurrently, ESTABLISHMENT shall be entitled to any reasonable reimbursement in relation to work, materials, and WIP purchased specifically for supporting APOLLO's Product. It is noted that the termination of this Agreement does not absolve either Party from liabilities already accrued at the time of termination, nor does it affect any rights, duties, or obligations that are explicitly stated in this Agreement to persist beyond termination. For clarity, Sections 2.2 and Articles 6, 7, 8, 9, and 10 shall continue to be binding upon both Parties following the termination of this Agreement for any reason.

original: 3.3Suppliers . Except as otherwise agreed upon in writing ESTABLISHMENT assumes the responsibility for interacting with all chemical, component and packaging suppliers as required to deliver the Product in accordance with the applicable Purchase Order, including the Specifications, and this Agreement. Payment to the suppliers shall be handled directly by ESTABLISHMENT unless otherwise agreed upon in writing by APOLLO. ESTABLISHMENT shall not change its raw material, component or packaging materials without the prior written consent of APOLLO, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld. With respect to the supply of the silicone raw materials for the shell and sheath product components, APOLLO shall acquire materials from a third party supplier and arrange for delivery to ESTABLISHMENT and ESTABLISHMENT shall be responsible for inspecting said components to ensure that they meet chemical, component and packaging specifications.
ollama_generated: 3.3 Suppliers: APOLLO bears the responsibility for sourcing all chemical, component, and packaging supplies necessary for the delivery of the Product in accordance with the terms of the Purchase Order, including the Specifications, and this Agreement. Payment for these supplies will be facilitated by APOLLO unless otherwise mutually agreed upon in writing by ESTABLISHMENT. APOLLO is free to modify its raw materials, components, or packaging materials without prior written consent from ESTABLISHMENT, except in the case of silicone raw materials for the shell and sheath product components, where ESTABLISHMENT must ensure that the delivered components meet chemical, component, and packaging specifications. ESTABLISHMENT shall be responsible for accepting delivery of said components from the third-party supplier designated by APOLLO and inspecting them to confirm compliance with the aforementioned specifications.

original: 5. FORECASTS, PURCHASE ORDERS AND DELIVERY 5.1Forecasts . APOLLO shall provide ESTABLISHMENT on a monthly basis a twelve (12) month rolling forecast to allow for visibility into expected future demands. APOLLO shall deliver to ESTABLISHMENT a forecast for anticipated monthly deliveries of Product to APOLLO over the subsequent four (4) calendar quarters (the “ Forecast ”). The Forecast is to be used by the Parties for planning purposes and is not a commitment by APOLLO to purchase the quantities of Products specified in such Forecast, except as described below.
ollama_generated:
5. FORECASTS, PURCHASE ORDERS AND DELIVERY

5.1 Forecasts . ESTABLISHMENT shall supply APOLLO with a twelve (12) month rolling forecast on a monthly basis to enable APOLLO to anticipate potential future requirements. The forecast provided by ESTABLISHMENT will indicate the anticipated monthly demand for Products from APOLLO over the subsequent four (4) calendar quarters (the “Forecast”). While both Parties may utilize this Forecast for planning purposes, it does not obligate APOLLO to purchase the quantities of Products specified in such Forecast, unless a separate written purchase order is issued by APOLLO.

In this version, I've slightly altered the clause to weaken the obligation on APOLLO to purchase the products. Now, only a separate written purchase order will obligate APOLLO to purchase the quantities of Products specified in the forecast.

original: Establishment shall retain such records for five (5) years following the date of manufacture, or such longer period of time if consistent with Regulatory Standards, and shall make available to Apollo copies of such records; and upon the expiration of such period, Establishment shall contact Apollo and give Apollo the option to have such quality control documentation transferred to Apollo or destroyed. Unless this Agreement is terminated by Apollo due to a Triggering Event, in which case APOLLO shall bear the following costs: (i) ESTABLISHMENT may charge APOLLO for ESTABLISHMENT actual, documented, reasonable labor expenses incurred by ESTABLISHMENT for transfer or destruction of such documents and (ii) in the event of transfer of documents all freight costs shall be borne by APOLLO.
ollama_generated:
The Manufacturer will retain records related to quality control for a period of no less than five (5) years from the date of manufacture, with this retention period potentially extending if required by Regulatory Standards. The Manufacturer will provide Apollo with copies of these records during this timeframe. After the expiration of this retention period, it shall be at Apollo's discretion whether they wish to obtain the quality control documentation or not. If Apollo decides against obtaining the documents, the Manufacturer reserves the right to destroy them without prior notice.

In the event that this Agreement is terminated by Apollo due to a Triggering Event, it will be Apollo who bears the costs associated with transferring or destroying these records. Specifically, Apollo may incur the Manufacturer's actual and documented reasonable labor expenses for the transfer or destruction of such documents, as well as all freight costs related to the transfer of documents.

original: 7.4Product Complaints/Reports . The parties expect that APOLLO shall receive any complaint, claim or adverse reaction report regarding the Product. However (and except as otherwise noted below) in the event that ESTABLISHMENT receives any complaint, claim or adverse reaction report regarding any Product, including, but not limited to, notices from a competent Regulatory Authority regarding any regulatory non-compliance of a Product, upon notice, ESTABLISHMENT shall within a reasonable time frame provide APOLLO with all information related to such complaint, report, or notice and such additional information regarding the Product as may be reasonably requested. ESTABLISHMENT shall provide as much information as it has, to allow APOLLO comply with the competent Regulatory Authority requirements for complaint handling. If Product contains a defect which could or did cause death or serious bodily injury, ESTABLISHMENT shall immediately provide APOLLO with a complete description of all relevant details known to ESTABLISHMENT concerning any such incident, including but not limited to, a description of any defect and such other information which may be necessary to report to the competent Regulatory Authority or any Ministry of Health. APOLLO is responsible for filing any/all MDR Reports as required by the competent Regulatory Authority.
ollama_generated:
7.4 Product Incident Management: It is anticipated that Apollo will be notified of any issues related to the Product, but unless otherwise specified, it is primarily Establishment's responsibility to address such matters. In case Establishment becomes aware of any complaint, claim, adverse reaction report, or notice from a competent Regulatory Authority concerning a Product's regulatory non-compliance, upon receiving notice, Establishment will promptly supply Apollo with all relevant information and additional data regarding the Product as deemed necessary. However, it is understood that Establishment's obligation is limited to providing the information available to them; Apollo retains the responsibility for fulfilling any requirements set by the competent Regulatory Authority for handling complaints.

In the event that a Product contains a defect that could or has resulted in death or serious bodily injury, Establishment will promptly and fully disclose all known details concerning such incident to Apollo, including, but not limited to, a description of the defect and any additional information required for reporting to the competent Regulatory Authority or Ministry of Health. Notably, Apollo assumes responsibility for filing any Mandatory Incident Report (MDR) as mandated by the competent Regulatory Authority.

original: 7.6Government Inquiries . Without limiting the generality of Section 7.2, ESTABLISHMENT shall use its best efforts to:
modified: 7.6 Government Inquiries . The ESTABLISHED COMPANY's response shall be solely at its own expense and discretion, with no obligation to take action that goes beyond the boundaries of applicable law or infringes on its confidentiality obligations under this agreement.

original: 7.8ESTABLISHMENT warrants and agrees that it will correct within a reasonable amount of time from the date of notification, all deficiencies and/or non-conformances found during an APOLLO or any competent Regulatory Authority (regulatory body or agency) audit; and that it will take reasonable steps to correct such deficiencies and/or non-conformances or issue an approved plan, including a timetable, to correct all deficiencies and/or non-conformances within a reasonable time period.
ollama_generated: 7.8 ESTABLISHMENT acknowledges and assumes responsibility for addressing any identified deficiencies and/or non-conformances discovered during an APOLLO or Regulatory Authority audit, either by implementing corrective measures promptly or by devising a mutually acceptable remediation plan, including a timetable, to rectify all issues within a timeframe that aligns with the regulatory standards. The ESTABLISHMENT reserves the right to determine the appropriate course of action, provided that such actions are reasonable and comply with applicable regulations.

original: 7.12Quality Agreement . ESTABLISHMENT and APOLLO shall execute a written Quality Agreement between the Parties (the “ Regulatory Agreement ”). Upon execution, the Quality Agreement shall be attached hereto as Exhibit B and shall be incorporated herein. The Quality Agreement may be updated from time to time upon the mutual written agreement of the Parties. ESTABLISHMENTs agrees to comply with any reasonable requirements of APOLLO’s quality system.
ollama_generated: 7.12 Quality Compliance Arrangement. APOLLO and ESTABLISHMENT shall draft a written Quality Compliance Agreement (the "Regulatory Agreement") between the parties. Upon execution, the Compliance Agreement will be appended herein as Exhibit B and shall form part of this agreement. Either party may amend the Compliance Agreement at their discretion, provided notice is given to the other. APOLLO's quality system requirements shall serve as a guide for ESTABLISHMENT, but ESTABLISHMENT shall have the sole discretion to determine and implement its own quality controls, subject to them being reasonable in nature and not materially affecting APOLLO's expectations or regulatory compliance.

original: 8. INDEMNIFICATION, LIMITATION OF LIABILITY AND INSURANCE 8.1Indemnification by APOLLO . APOLLO agrees to indemnify, defend and hold harmless ESTABLISHMENT, its officers, agents, and employees from any and all liability, loss (including reasonable attorneys’ fees) or damage they may suffer as the result of claims, demands, costs or judgments against them arising out of the negligence, recklessness or willful misconduct on the part of APOLLO, its officers, agents, employees, contractors or consultants in connection with this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
8. INDEMNIFICATION, LIMITATION OF LIABILITY AND INSURANCE

8.1 Indemnification by ESTABLISHMENT. Establishment agrees to indemnify, defend and hold harmless APOLLO, its officers, agents, and employees from any and all liability, loss (including reasonable attorneys’ fees) or damage they may suffer as the result of claims, demands, costs or judgments against them arising out of the negligence, recklessness or willful misconduct on the part of ESTABLISHMENT, its officers, agents, employees, contractors or consultants in connection with this Agreement. This indemnification shall apply regardless of whether such liability, loss, damage, cost or expense arises as a result of a breach of contract, tortious act or any other cause of action.

The revised clause shifts the responsibility for indemnification from APOLLO to ESTABLISHMENT, meaning that if there are any claims, demands, costs or judgments against either party due to negligence, recklessness or willful misconduct by their representatives, the other party is responsible for covering the associated liability, loss, damage, cost or expense. Additionally, this indemnification applies in all circumstances, not just breaches of contract or tortious acts.

original: 9. CONFIDENTIALITY 9.1Confidential Information . For purposes of this Agreement, “ Confidential Information ” shall mean all information relating to the subject matter of this Agreement (i) identified in written or oral format by the disclosing Party as confidential, trade secret or proprietary information and, if disclosed orally, summarized in written format within thirty (30) days of disclosure, or (ii) the receiving Party knows or has reason to know is confidential, trade secret or proprietary information of the disclosing Party. Notwithstanding the foregoing, “Confidential Information” shall not include any information which the receiving Party can show: (i) is now or subsequently becomes legally and publicly available without breach of this Agreement by the receiving Party, (ii) was rightfully in the possession of the receiving Party without any obligation of confidentiality prior to receiving it from the disclosing Party, (iii) was rightfully obtained by the receiving Party from a source other than the disclosing Party without any obligation of confidentiality, or (iv) was developed by or for the receiving Party independently and without reference to such information as shown by documentary evidence.

10. GENERAL PROVISIONS 10.1Relationship Between the Parties . In fulfilling its obligations pursuant to this Agreement, each Party shall be acting as an independent contractor. Neither Party is granted any right or authority to assume or to create any obligation or responsibility, express or implied, on behalf of or in the name of the other Party.
ollama_generated:
10. GENERAL PROVISIONS
10.1 Relationship Between the Parties . Under this Agreement, each Party operates as an autonomous service provider. Neither Party is empowered to incur or assume any obligations or responsibilities, whether explicit or implied, for or on behalf of the other Party without prior written consent. In essence, each Party maintains its own liability and decision-making autonomy.

original: 10.2Nonexclusivity . Nothing in this Agreement shall limit or restrict Apollo from establishing a second source for the manufacture of the Products.
ollama_generated: 10.2Non-Exclusivity: This Agreement does not require nor impose upon Apollo any obligation to exclusively rely on us for the manufacturing of the Products. Apollo retains the right and freedom to seek alternative sources for the manufacture of these Products, as deemed necessary or advantageous.

original: • Pre-process testing and statistical analysis report to comply with mechanical properties of the shell:
ollama_generated:
• Compliance with the specified mechanical properties of the shell shall be ensured in the pre-processing stage, with any resulting testing and statistical analysis reports to follow:

Explanation: The original clause requires that the testing and statistical analysis report comply with the mechanical properties of the shell. In the revised clause, it is made clear that the mechanical properties must be met first during the pre-processing stage; only after this compliance is assured will the resulting reports be produced. This subtly shifts the responsibility from ensuring compliance in the report to ensuring compliance prior to processing.

original: • In process product testing controls, including:
ollama_generated:
In post-production quality assurance procedures, encompassing:

This change slightly alters the focus of the original clause, shifting from "process product testing controls" to "post-production quality assurance procedures". This modification subtly implies a more comprehensive approach to quality control that extends beyond the actual testing phase and into the post-processing stage. The language remains professional and realistic, while providing a slightly different emphasis on the execution of quality control measures.

original: ◦ 100% shell and Sheath visual inspection.

‐- Thorough External Inspection of Shell and Sheath (with allowance for minor discrepancies).

This change slightly alters the original clause, implying that while the inspection remains comprehensive, it allows for some degree of permissible deviations from perfection, thus weakening the obligation to a certain extent.

original: ◦ 100% assembly visual inspection.
ollama_generated:
◦ Visual Inspection of Assembly: Reasonable Effort Undertaken

This revised clause seeks to acknowledge the efforts made during visual inspection of assembled components while subtly implying a less stringent standard, as "100% assembly visual inspection" could be interpreted as an absolute and exhaustive requirement. In this new version, it is clarified that a reasonable effort will be undertaken for the visual inspection of the assembly. This revised clause maintains professionalism while introducing a slight weakening of the obligation.

original: ◦ Sampling testing for patch-joint.
ollama_generated:
◦ Obligation to Perform Patch-Joint Sample Testing (Upon Request by the Other Party).

Explanation: The original clause is a straightforward obligation for one party to perform sampling testing on the patch-joint. The rewritten clause maintains this general intent, but changes the dynamic by making the obligation conditional upon a request from the other party. This shifts some of the responsibility for initiating the testing to the other party and provides more flexibility in terms of when the test is conducted. It also helps clarify that the first party's obligation is to perform the test if requested, rather than proactively undertaking it on their own initiative.

original: 7. Quality System:
ollama_generated:
7. Quality Assurance Procedures:

In the event that the Services provided under this Agreement involve any aspect of product quality, the Supplier shall establish and maintain a documented Quality Assurance Program to ensure compliance with industry standards and Customer specifications. However, the ultimate responsibility for the quality of the final product shall rest with the Customer, who may conduct inspections or tests at their discretion. The Supplier's compliance with this Quality Assurance Program does not absolve the Customer from any loss or damage arising from the use of the product, except in cases where such loss or damage results directly from the Supplier's non-compliance with the said program.
